text.text_translated:
Meagan McGrath is from Canada.
She likes hard trips.
She always wants to do a new hard thing, not just one.
She climbed the highest mountain on every continent.
She rode a bike across Canada.
She ran a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert.
This desert is a very hot place.
It was 45 degrees hot there.

But her trip to the South Pole was her most amazing trip.
She went there on skis.
The South Pole has a lot of ice.

On the first day, she fell into a glacier.
A glacier is a very big river of ice.
Someone had to help her.

Most people would stop then.
But Meagan did not stop.
She decided to go on.

She pulled a thing behind her.
It had her tent and all her food.
She pulled it through very, very cold.
There were bad ice storms.
She reached the South Pole 40 days later.

The Sahara Desert is a very hot place.

But her trip to the South Pole was her most difficult trip.
She went there on skis.
The South Pole has a lot of ice.

A glacier is a very big river of ice.
Someone had to help her.
